intro: Leptochilus listeri, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky habitats at high elevations. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Leptochilus listeri is known for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its striking floral display.
